clinical_study.official_title: Correlation of Hospital Stay Length With the Glucose Measured Continuously Levels After Cardiac Surgery

brief_summary.textblock: The study is designed to test if there is any correlation between the glucose levels in the postoperatory period and the length of hospital stay.

detailed_description.textblock:
The stress hyperglycemia commonly observed in the postoperatory period, there have been several studies to assess if there is benefit of having a strict glucose control or not.
This study will assess if there is correlation between the glucose levels measured continuously with the length of the stay in the hospital.

primary_outcome.description: Glucose will be continuously monitored for 5 days

secondary_outcome.time_frame: [Days] Within the first 20 days after surgery
secondary_outcome.description: The days that the patient remains in the hospital after the surgery.

arm_group.description: The glucose of 48 patients will be measured during 5 days after cardiac surgery.

intervention.description: Glucose level will be measured after cardiac surgery.

study_pop.textblock: Patients with a programmed cardiac surgery

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Physical status classification of the American Society of Anesthesiologists (ASA) II-IV
- Patients programmed for cardiac surgery
- Any body mass index
Exclusion Criteria:
- Pregnant women
- Chronic Kidney Disease (CKD) Stage 2 or higher
